ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The lab rotations are a great way to get hands-on experience in a lab of interest. It provides a good opportunity to interact daily with the PI, students and fellows, and helps you to evaluate whether the lab and research are a good fit.
Rotation is very important for our choosing lab, so we should really put effort into it.
Well, you kinda have to take research rotations before joining a lab, so this is absolutely crucial regardless of what experience you had

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course so far has helped me to evaluate in what lab I would like to pursue my dissertation research.
by rotating in different labs, we get to know the labs better and also more involved with the research of the lab. Overall, this is a very nice course.
Understood further RNA biology in viruses.
